Class SearchTests

java.lang.Object
application.SearchTests
public class SearchTests extends Object
The SearchTests class contains automated JUnit test cases for the search functionality of the Qinvalid input: '&A' application.

This class tests the searchQuestions(String, List<String>) helper method, ensuring that it correctly returns search results for various scenarios. Each test case documents both the expected (positive) outcome and what a negative outcome would look like if the functionality were broken.

Javadoc Inspiration: Oracle's Java Collections Framework documentation (Oracle Collections) is used as a model for clarity and consistency.

Author:
Sumedha Gupta

  • Method Details

    • searchQuestions

      public static String searchQuestions(String keyword, List<String> questions)
      Performs a search over the provided list of questions.

      The search is case-insensitive. It returns a header with the search keyword followed by each matching question on a new line. If no matching questions are found, it appends a message stating that. If the keyword is empty or null, it returns a prompt asking for a keyword.

      Parameters:
      keyword - the search keyword
      questions - the list of questions to search
      Returns:
      a String containing the search results or an appropriate message if no matches are found

    • testSearchKeywordFound

      @Test public void testSearchKeywordFound()
      Test Case 1: Search with a keyword that exists in the list.

      Positive Outcome: When the keyword "midterm" is searched, the result should include the question that contains "midterm".
      Negative Outcome: If the search fails to find the question or returns no results despite a match.

    • testSearchKeywordNotFound

      @Test public void testSearchKeywordNotFound()
      Test Case 2: Search with a keyword that does not exist in the list.

      Positive Outcome: When searching for "final", the method should return a header and a message indicating that no matching questions were found.
      Negative Outcome: If the method returns unrelated questions or crashes.

    • testSearchEmptyKeyword

      @Test public void testSearchEmptyKeyword()
      Test Case 3: Search with an empty keyword.

      Positive Outcome: When an empty string is provided, the method should prompt the user to enter a keyword.
      Negative Outcome: If the method attempts to search or returns an error message unrelated to the empty input.

    • testSearchCaseInsensitive

      @Test public void testSearchCaseInsensitive()
      Test Case 4: Search should be case-insensitive.

      Positive Outcome: Searching for "midterm" should match questions regardless of case, e.g., "Midterm" in the text.
      Negative Outcome: If the search is case-sensitive and fails to find the matching question.

    • testSearchSpecialCharacters

      @Test public void testSearchSpecialCharacters()
      Test Case 5: Search with special characters.

      Positive Outcome: When searching for a special character like "?", the method should return all questions that include that character.
      Negative Outcome: If the search does not handle special characters properly or returns incomplete results.
